name: 傅子恒
objective:
The breakthrough in Generative AI (GAI) technology has brought about a significant transformation in multimedia content design, with AI-generated videos, images, and text approaching the proficiency level of professionals. This course focuses on two major technologies: Large Language Models (LLM) and Diffusion Models, utilizing open-source tools such as Llama and Stable Diffusion for hands-on practice. In addition to providing an in-depth and comprehensive explanation of the working principles of LLMs and Diffusion Models, the course also teaches students the fundamental operation of AI and how to efficiently produce high-quality and creative AI-generated content. By mastering generative AI technology and its applications, students will be able to embed AI-generated multimedia content into various information systems, significantly enhancing system functionality, aesthetics, and user experience. This course aims to equip students with solid skills in learning, research, and application, achieving a human-AI co-creation of hypermedia content.

* Both theories and applications will be covered.
* Use Python + Keras for coding in W01~W06.
schedule:
===Introduction to Generative AI	
W01	Overview of Generative AI
W02	Basics of Generative AI (1) – Linear algebra, Back propagation, Linear regression, Classifier
W03	Basics of Generative AI (2) – Auto encoder, VAE
W04	Basics of Generative AI (3) – RNN, Transformer
W05	Basics of Generative AI (4) – Diffusion model
===Large Language Models (LLMs)	
W06	Introduction to LLMs – Prompt engineering
W07	LLM applications - Reading/Writing/Coding
W08	Fine-tuning a LLM
W09	Mid-term Week
W10	LLM RAG
===Diffusion Models	
W11	Introduction to Diffusion Models
W12	Clip Prompt Engineering
W13	Fine-tuning a Diffusion Model - TI
W14	Fine-tuning a Diffusion Model - DB
W15	ControlNet
===Other Models	
W16	Audio Generation
W17	Video Generation
W18	Final Week
